name: Eddie Stewart
text:
Wifi not working @ 5 pm

name: Angela Frances
text: Small town library. The people here are pretty friendly. Most the computers are usually always taken. The Internet isn't very fast. They're hours of operation are also very minimum

name: Nancy Thompson
text: Little library with big small town hospitality! 24/7 WiFi, public computers, large print books, audio books, DVD & Blu-ray movies, non-fiction, short stories, biographies, classics, and a children's section. Over 18,000 items! They always have the Baldwin County, AL & Escambia/Santa Rosa Counties. FL coupon books for sale for $15; 50% goes to the library. FAX/copier available. No charge for services but donations are greatly appreciated! Do not need to be a Lillian resident to get a library card. This is their 25th year in operation.

They do need funding, so try to leave a donation.

text: I enjoyed my coworkers when I was working here. But the ADMINISTRATION STINKS. Library is run by a bunch of unprofessional people who know each other. If they spent time fixing their administration the library would be in tip top shape. ADMIN spends there time chit chatting about none sense instead of actually helping employees! If you’re looking for a job avoid this place at all costs. Go to a different library system.

text: The Staff here are nice, always helpful and always with an answer to your question. It's a great safe place after  school, since I  know I'm protected, a guard at every entrance. A peaceful place to do my homework, with two levels, its a great place to have.  The events here are also amazing with different authors and guests.

name: Josh Yates
text: The downtown Montgomery library has become a great asset for the city whereas it delivers online books, audio books, numerous books on the shelf for check out, and a place for kids to hang out after school. Instead of me buying books for $10 or more on Amazon, I go this modernized library and check the book out for 3 weeks for free. The new library cards are also modernized and no longer paper and library staff are all kind, helpful, and friendly.

name: Naima Nim
text:
And I told the patrol officer that she walked passed me several times while I was on the phone and I was by myself not causing any problems and she said yes I saw you several times. During my conversation with the patrol officer the director walks pass both of us, says nothing, walks out of the door and stands on the steps leaning over the rail for about 15 minutes. Now it just me and the patrol officer in the hallway, me and the patrol officer walk into the secretary's office and I am asking the secretary if there was a corporate number or anything. She comes up behind me and the patrol officer and starts yelling again " GET OUT OF MY OFFICE YOU ARE NOT GOING TO HARRAS MY STAFF AND BRING THEM IN THIS MATTER" And I turned around and stated " what? I did leave you office, this is your office to? she yelled "ALL OF THESES OFFICES ARE MY OFFICE, I AM THE DIRECTOR OF 10 LIBRARIES  AND YOU ARE HARRASING US". And I stated to her I only asked for the corporate number. The director closed her office, walked outside, walked back into another office that I was in and told the secretary not to give me anything, not to communicate with me. So I said I see this issue has just escalated please call the police, then to director says call the police. The director then stated "YOU ARE TRYING TO PUSH ME AROUND" I was mortified I stated to her I have not touched you or yelled at you", you are literally causing a scene, and other employees are standing in the hallway trying to figure out what's going on. To add insult to injury the person that I was reporting( The assistant director) walks in the door way and just stands there with a laugh on her face and saying what. Now this director in the beginning of the conversation said that she could not have us in the same room and then the assistant director literally stands in the door? (THE PATROL OFFICER HERSELF SAID TO ME, THIS IS CRAZY BUT I ALSO UNDERSTAND WHERE YOU ARE COMING FROM THERE IS NOTHING I CAN DO THE DIRECTOR IS OVER ME AND I HAVE ONLY BEEN WORKING HER FOR 3 WEEKS) Are you serious no one called you at all in the matter and now you just pop up . The patrol officer stated that since the director wants you out of the facility you have to stand outside, so I asked the patrol officer could I get my books because I was studying and she said yes and then stand outside. As I get on the elevator she then goes to talk to the assistant director. I'm sitting outside and the police walk right past me so I know where they were going so when they came back downstairs I said excuse me and the police officers were like oh ok they mean you so I explain the situation and they stated that the could not handle the situation write a letter to the mayor.

WHAT DOES A FAMILY DEATH HAVE TO DO WITH A PERSONAL MATTER DIRECTOR? I WENT TO A FUNERAL ON 10/02/2017 BUT DID I DISRECPECT YOU OR YOUR STAFF.

YOU REFUSED TO HELP ME DIRECTOR
YOU REFUSED TO GIVE ME INFO ON SOMEONE ABOVE YOU
YOU TOLD YOUR SECRETARY NOT TO RELEASE ANY INFO TO ME
QUESTION IF YOU WERE SO EMOTIONAL ABOUT "DEATH" HOW DID YOU HAVE TIME TO JACK YOUR MACK AND TELL ME THAT YOU ARE THE DIRECTOR OF 10 LIBRARIES

text: Excellent place to be.

name: John Edward Voigtlander O'Keefe
text: Wow! This was a real pleasant surprise. I appreciated the special architecture of the building. I had a very enjoyable experience and the staff was helpful.

name: Kevin M
text: Nice library. Relaxing place. Has a nice view.

name: Kaylee Kat (KayleeKat)
text: As a student who is constantly studying and doing homework. Today I came in and sat in the upstairs loft hoping for a quiet place to study. Turns out I would have been better off at home. I could hear people loudly talking from the first floor. Mothers bringing in screaming children and folks using the meeting room without closing the door were heard having discussions. Staff did nothing to quell the ungodly distractions and added to it with their unrestrained voices. Take some example from the Daphne library and maintain a quiet atmosphere. I’ll think twice before visiting SFPL to complete my studies. I only give three stars because of the nice facilities and resources some of the staff are completely nice and professional. SFPL needs to work on maintaining a quiet, learning environment. I am very disappointed and hope for improvement.

name: JustMe ThatsFine
text: This is the most beautiful library I've ever been in!

name: Dia Donson
text: First time visiting. Exterior and interior is very immaculate. Staff was very helpful and polite. Live that is easy to print by adding cash or coins.

name: Erik Warrington
text: Very good.Staff  is always  knowledge able and friendly.

name: Penny Zingre
text: Wow! Troy has the best public library I have ever been to! We love the children's area the most! You can even read ebooks with your card. Lots of great books, movies, and magazines. We got cards today and will definitely be back!

name: Ruth Carnley
text: Most impressive library I've seen in a long time.  The genealogical room upstairs was a gold mine!  All of the staff were very knowledgeable and very helpful, especially the lady in that room.  I'm from out-of-town, and I will definitely be back!  Thank you!

This is a state of the art facility with the friendliest staff anywhere . More than you could ever imagine a library experience could be like.
They have free computers with good internet connections or bring your own to use the free internet wifi in a private quiet room.
The Administration has done an exceptional job to provide the community with the very best in a modern library experience for all ages .

text: Very helpful staff and convenient hours. They are open on Saturdays and late on Tuesdays and Thursdays.  A town as small as Columbiana is fortunate to have a  full-service library like this one.

name: Rachel Williams
text: They are never open, 3-4 hours a day is all. I have to drive right by that library to go to the Chelsea or another library (full regular hours) to get a book because Columbiana is always closed. If you work or go to school you can forget it. Even the tiny Wilsonville Library has (much) better hours. That’s very inconvenient and poor community service.

name: Linda Mott (LMOTT)
text: Went here to use the computer and print a document. The key board could use a good cleaning. Some of the bookshelves were covered in plastic but did not ask why. No one else in there when I arrived.

resp.text: We currently sanitize the keyboard with Lysol between each use. Unfortunately doing this for over a year has had an adverse effect on most surfaces including keyboards. After inspecting the keyboard, my staff and I have decided that we will only sanitize after we close. Patrons will be responsible for sanitizing hands after using the computer. We have hand sanitizer available for the public.

name: Sheila Dreblow
text: It was not good only one computer working

resp.text: Due to the governors recent directive regarding 6 feet apart and limited space in the library, we only have room for 1 computer. 6 feet apart is still in effect, as of 9 April 2021, for persons of different households.

I've noticed it doesnt seem to used much by lawyers on the few times I've been in only to see one or 2 people who don't work there. Too bad being a lawyer by ability to afford law school was really about money and not more important qualifications such as character and merit.

name: Micah Hignight
text: Unfriendly. Went to story time with my 3-yr old (which was fun), then asked the nice woman who ran story time if there was any children's area in the library (story time was in a side room off the entryway). She suggested my son would like to see the fish tank, so we went into the main area. My friend and I chatted for a few minutes as our kids looked at the fish. The elderly man running the front desk interrupted us with "THIS is a LIBRARY. You need to be quieter!!" And stormed off, very offended looking. I honestly thought it was a joke at first. There were maybe 5 other people in the whole library, so it's not as if we were disturbing people who were trying to study (& the kids were quiet, so he was definitely referring to our conversation). Even if we were being too loud in his opinion, I can think of a million nicer ways to tell us! I would not have been offended by a "excuse me, would you mind taking your conversation into the hallway?" I've been to plenty of other libraries, many in this area, and never had a problem with this. Not going to return to this one!

name: Ky Marie
text: Has a good selection of books, although not many complete series. They do have a convenient program where you can borrow from other libraries and have them brought to your library to check out. Computers aren't the greatest but still better than most and the price of printing per page is great.

name: Karen Cook
text: We love this library. We've been going to Pelham Public Library for 11 years and I don't have one complaint. We've been to other libraries in the general area, but this one is our favorite. Before the pandemic, we were going 3-5 times a week.  The librarians are so friendly and informative.  The tech librarian has been so good for my teens. He's always available to help them whether it be library or career related. The teen librarian is always super friendly and happy to see us and willing to order books my kids are interested in when the budget allows. We have had great experiences with the children's librarians as well over the years. So much so, my daughter volunteered to help them for a couple of years after she aged out of the teen librarian program. Overall, our family loves this library, and I highly recommend it.

Oberall, they are just great workers and people who love what they do but don't always get compensated for it. Most importantly, I just want to show my appreciation and love for all of them down to Chris, Matt and the women for being so kind and generous during these difficult times. Keep up the great work and don't stop what your doing even on those bad days because you never know whose day you can change but being so compassionate and kind. No matter what your position or title is. You all have a great team and thanks for being a light in the community of Pelham.

name: Edwin Baumann
text: This library is phenomenal (and I write this as a municipal library employee in a city of 1.3 million). The collection is large considering the catchment, and items from elsewhere in Baldwin County are easy to place holds on for free and they arrive promptly. I also appreciate that there is not a fanaticism for weeding, which means that there's a great inventory of older material on the shelves, as well as very current books. The DVD collection is extensive, and there's a big collection of puzzles to borrow. The patio outside with Adirondack chairs is lovely, the staff are friendly and helpful, and honestly, it would be hard to improve upon this library.

resp.text: Thank you so much!  It is a truly wonderful place to work and we are glad that you are happy with our services.

name: JEREMY PERKINS
text: Tried to order a new library card online but didn't know my card number. Guy on the phone was extremely rude and wouldn't help. Came in a few weeks later to get a replacement card. After being a member of this library for years I apparently wasn't in the system. They refused to put me in as a local member and only would input me as a tourist because my new address didn't match my drivers license and I didn't have anything two prove I lived where I do. Every one of the employees at the counter looked down their nose at me because I simply didn't have a piece of mail with my new address on my person. Foley staff has always been 100 times better.

resp.text: I’m terribly sorry you had a poor experience with our library.  We strive to serve everyone.  To start the library card process online or in person it is not necessary to know your previous card number.  You can sign up as a new member.  To complete the process when you come into the library we ask for a valid picture ID such as a driver’s license.  You can get a vacationer card with an address other than Gulf Shores. This provides you immediate access to our many resources including eBooks, eMagazines, eAudio Books and streaming video as well as our print materials.  This is not a temporary card.  You can update your account at any time by bringing in a piece of mail with your Gulf Shores address on it.  We apologize for your bad experience and would like the opportunity to serve you.

name: Charlie Boy
text:
This is by far one of the nicest libraries I've ever had the privilege to be in. Probably because the entire thing seems to have been donated by the patrons. Every room seems to come with a tag saying who it was donated by.

Pros: Extremely nice location. Well lit. Open floor plan. And a snack area! Also seems to be the first one I've ever seen to have a dedicated History Room! Changing station in the snack area is a wonderful touch.

Cons: I'm personally against the idea of being allowed to eat In the library proper. So the lack of a seating area in the snack area is a minor point against the place. But to be honest since it's a personal preference I can't really count it against the library.

This is a great place with a wide variety of books, movies (They've even got old episodes of Doctor Who!), periodicals. Private study rooms, children's section, and the bike rack spelling library is a nice touch. A great local library in a nice town.

resp.text: Hey Charlie - thanks for the kind words!!  The seats in the Cafe were previously removed for Covid caution... you'll be glad to know the tables and chairs have returned!  Thanks so much for the kind words - it means a lot to us.

What a wonderful facility.  Quite a good book collection, but the study areas are what I've been seeking.  Tables and desks with plenty of available outlets placed all over the adult floor.  Several private meeting rooms available.  Sufficient hours.

Just one mistake the architect made:  a railing in the 2nd floor adult area overlooks the foyer where occasional conversations and noise from an adjacent entertainment room funnel straight up to the adult study area.  First remodel job should be extending the 2nd floor over the entrance placing some cozy furniture near those beautiful windows overlooking the greenspace across the street!

It's too bad this is the closest library to me... I've had several poor experiences here lately.  It's the inadequate facility & patrons, not the staff, that I consider to be the problem.  A nearby high school means lots of loud kids after school.  Also other disrespectful adults carrying on long cellphone conversations and tudoring sessions going on in a tight area of the only available tables.  Quiet rules are respected pretty well in the room with public PC's, but the rest of the place could be mistaken for a frat house scene.  ...and finding a satisfactory place to plug-in a laptop, or winning the lottery... which will happen before I'm dead?

Oh, the book collection, you ask?  I suppose people do still look at those in libraries on occasion...  the selection is just o.k.  Of course with the Jefferson Cnty Library Cooperative's sharing program, you have fairly convenient access to a vast library.

text: They did a good job of putting things in place (signs, markers & partitions) due to the Pandemic. You are in no doubt about their procedures or rules, as you are greeted by a Greeter (nice). They have a 3 days Quarantine policy for Return Items, which I think is Awesome. Each department you enter in the Library (Children's, Technology, Reference, Connection Center & the 1st floor), has a table or a cart for you to leave your books or other items, after browsing the shelves. They also provide Gloves (thank you!!) for when browsing their items. Still loving the Curbside services also. Every Staff, all the way down to the Janitorial Staff & Security Guards, are keeping with their policy of wearing a mask at all time, while still maintaining a safe distance away. Thank You Ben May MAIN Library!!!😷😷😷
